update.description:
I am not sure if this is a gazebo or OGRE bug. gazebo crashes when loading collada files with multiple geometries and some of the geometries does not have skins associated with it.

This happens because gazebo loads the whole collada model as a single mesh, with the geometries as each submesh. This creates a situation where the mesh can have a skeletion associated with it but some of its submesh has no blend weights and OGRE throws an error regarding missing blend weights.

This PR works around this by creating a dummy node assignment so that it passes the OGRE check.
update.title: fix crash when loading submesh with no bone assignments

content.raw: After trying and failing to fix the regressions, I decided to revert loading the whole scene into the skeleton. The dummy root node hack needed to do that messes too much with the way gazebo expects where the root node should be. I think a better fix is to allow Loaders to import a vector of meshes, this could be something to look at in the next version of ignition.
content.html: After trying and failing to fix the regressions, I decided to revert loading the whole scene into the skeleton. The dummy root node hack needed to do that messes too much with the way gazebo expects where the root node should be. I think a better fix is to allow Loaders to import a vector of meshes, this could be something to look at in the next version of ignition.

pull_request.title: fix crash when loading submesh with no bone assignments

pullrequest.title: fix crash when loading submesh with no bone assignments

content.html:
just pushed a workaround for this, the problem is caused by some incompatibilities to the changes I need to make to support loading collada models with multiple root nodes, quoting my comments:

  // FIXME: use the 1st animation available when requesting for
  // "gazebo_dummy_root" due to a regression caused by adding support to load
  // more complex collada models. This is caused by the problem that collada
  // describes a scene and we load the scene as a mesh for an actor. The scene
  // can have multiple root nodes but a mesh can have only one skeleton and a
  // skeleton only can have one root node. The workaround is to add a dummy
  // root node to the skeleton but it can cause it to crash here as the dummy
  // root does not have animations associated with it.

‌

I am not sure if this is a gazebo or OGRE bug. gazebo crashes when loading collada files with multiple geometries and some of the geometries does not have skins associated with it.

This happens because gazebo loads the whole collada model as a single mesh, with the geometries as each submesh. This creates a situation where the mesh can have a skeletion associated with it but some of its submesh has no blend weights and OGRE throws an error regarding missing blend weights.

This PR works around this by creating a dummy node assignment so that it passes the OGRE check.

content.raw: [This](https://www.acodersjourney.com/20-abi-breaking-changes/) says no functions can be removed, while [this](https://community.kde.org/Policies/Binary_Compatibility_Issues_With_C%2B%2B) says it's ok if it's private. Let's run the ABI checker :)
content.html: This says no functions can be removed, while this says it's ok if it's private. Let's run the ABI checker :)

update.description:
I am not sure if this is a gazebo or OGRE bug. gazebo crashes when loading collada files with multiple geometries and some of the geometries does not have skins associated with it.

This happens because gazebo loads the whole collada model as a single mesh, with the geometries as each submesh. This creates a situation where the mesh can have a skeletion associated with it but some of its submesh has no blend weights and OGRE throws an error regarding missing blend weights.

This PR works around this by creating a dummy node assignment so that it passes the OGRE check.
update.title: fix crash when loading submesh with no bone assignments

pull_request.title: fix crash when loading submesh with no bone assignments

pullrequest.title: fix crash when loading submesh with no bone assignments

content.raw:
I have suspicions that this line is enough to fix the bug, I will try reverting and see if it works.

```
+    // clear previous node weights
+    _mesh->GetSkeleton()->SetNumVertAttached(0);
```

‌
content.html:
I have suspicions that this line is enough to fix the bug, I will try reverting and see if it works.

+    // clear previous node weights
+    _mesh->GetSkeleton()->SetNumVertAttached(0);

‌

content.raw: I added a new test case for multiple submeshes, also changed the way skeletons are loaded to fix another bug that happens in the test case.
content.html: I added a new test case for multiple submeshes, also changed the way skeletons are loaded to fix another bug that happens in the test case.

pull_request.title: fix crash when loading submesh with no bone assignments

update.description:
I am not sure if this is a gazebo or OGRE bug. gazebo crashes when loading collada files with multiple geometries and some of the geometries does not have skins associated with it.

This happens because gazebo loads the whole collada model as a single mesh, with the geometries as each submesh. This creates a situation where the mesh can have a skeletion associated with it but some of its submesh has no blend weights and OGRE throws an error regarding missing blend weights.

This PR works around this by creating a dummy node assignment so that it passes the OGRE check.
update.title: fix crash when loading submesh with no bone assignments
